page.title: 09St. Cuthberts Church Cont
page.content: are on a panel at the west end of the church.{THE ORGAN}, between nave and chancel was built in 1880 and renovated in 1959 by J.H.Cowine.The inscription at the base of the brass { {LECTERN}records that it was presented with thanks for the safe-keeping of Harold Sharp Leigh Slater when run over by a cab in Leicester Street in 1885.The elaborately carved { {REREDOS,PANELS AND ALTAR},were originally in St. Peter's Church, Liverpool and were erected in their present position in 1922 when that church was demolished.The East Window was donated in 1914 by the late C.H.Fleetwood-Hesketh, in memory of his ancestors who worshipped at the Church.
